paper_metadata.title: Rural Minimum Living Standard Guarantee (Rural Dibao) and Child Nutrition Outcomes in China

program_information.program_name: Rural Minimum Living Standard Guarantee (Rural Dibao)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: This program is one of the most extensive unconditional cash transfer (UCT) programs targeted at rural households in China

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Our results suggest that Rural Dibao significantly impacts the nutrition outcomes of children up to 15 years of age. Specifically, our results suggest that Rural Dibao improves child height-to-age z-scores by 1.05 standard deviations and lowers the probability of stunting by 11.9 percentage points
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We exploit propensity score matching and difference-in-differences techniques to evaluate the effects of the Rural Dibao program on child nutrition outcomes

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The Rural Minimum Living Standard Guarantee (Rural Dibao) is an important unconditional cash transfer program to alleviate poverty in rural China
evidence_citations.country_citation: The Rural Minimum Living Standard Guarantee (Rural Dibao) is an important unconditional cash transfer program to alleviate poverty in rural China
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: One primary goal of the Rural Minimum Living Standard Guarantee (Rural Dibao) Program is to establish a social safety net for alleviating poverty and related issues facing vulnerable households
